$eref.description: All went well, and (usually) some data was returned.

___status.description: the status for a succesful handling

___data.description: Acts as the wrapper for any data returned by the API call. If the call returns no data (as in the last example), data should be set to null.

$eref.description: There was a problem with the data submitted, or some pre-condition of the API call wasn't satisfied

___status.description: the status for a failure handling

___data.description: provides the wrapper for the details of why the request failed. If the reasons for failure correspond to POST values, the response object's keys SHOULD correspond to those POST values.

$eref.description: An error occurred in processing the request, i.e. an exception was thrown

___status.description: the status for a error handling

___data.description: A generic container for any other information about the error, i.e. the conditions that caused the error, stack traces, etc.

description: This is a json-schema for the jsend format for json responses for applications. see https://labs.omniti.com/labs/jsend/wiki
title: jsend json schema

_88success.description: All went well, and (usually) some data was returned.

___status.description: the status for a succesful handling

$eref.description: a generic container for data returned for success, fail or error

___data.description: Acts as the wrapper for any data returned by the API call. If the call returns no data (as in the last example), data should be set to null.

_88fail.description: There was a problem with the data submitted, or some pre-condition of the API call wasn't satisfied

___status.description: the status for a failure handling

$eref.description: a generic container for data returned for success, fail or error

___data.description: provides the wrapper for the details of why the request failed. If the reasons for failure correspond to POST values, the response object's keys SHOULD correspond to those POST values.

_88error.description: An error occurred in processing the request, i.e. an exception was thrown

___status.description: the status for a error handling

$eref.description: A meaningful, end-user-readable (or at the least log-worthy) message, explaining what went wrong in an error result.
A numeric code corresponding to the error in an error result, if applicable
a generic container for data returned for success, fail or error
